page.title: 07OXENHOLME STATION.
page.content: The station is about a hundred years old, is 550m. long and can fit sixteen coaches along each of its platforms. The last{steam train}passed through in 1971. Since then the old engine shed has been demolished, the crossing and turntable filled in, the platforms extended and the line electrified. There are twelve staff with up to four thousand people using the station in the summer. A hundred{trains}go through every day; thirty-six stop for passengers,ten are{freight}and the rest are through trains. The station has always been accident free. If a train is late a 'phone call is received from{Manchester}or{Carlisle, most trains coming from{London}or {Glasgow.}If there is a power cut the emergency substation in{Natland}is used for up to forty eight hours, after which diesel trains are used.
